examples.sentence: ために - For the purpose of

sections.heading: What is て as a Reason?
sections.content:
The て-form can express casual reasons or causes, similar to "because" or "and then." It's very natural in spoken Japanese and softer than から.

お腹が空いて、コンビニに行った "I was hungry, (so) I went to the convenience store" 雨が降って、試合が中止になった "It rained, (so) the match was cancelled" 嬉しくて、泣いちゃった "I was (so) happy, I cried"

children.heading: Uses standard て-form
children.content: | Verb/Adjective | て-form | Example | | -------------- | ------- | ---------------- | | 食べる | 食べて | 食べて、寝た | | 行く | 行って | 行って、見た | | 高い | 高くて | 高くて、買えない | | 便利 | 便利で | 便利で、好き | | 学生 | 学生で | 学生で、忙しい |

children.heading: Same conjugation as regular て-form
children.content: Verbs: Standard て-form conjugation い-adjectives: Remove い + くて な-adjectives/Nouns: + で

children.heading: Expressing cause and effect
children.content: 疲れて、眠くなった "I got tired, (so) I became sleepy" 道が混んでて、遅れた "The road was crowded, (so) I was late" 忙しくて、時間がない "I'm busy, (so) I don't have time"

children.heading: Natural consequences
children.content: 雨が降って、中止になった "It rained, (so) it was cancelled" 安くて、たくさん買った "It was cheap, (so) I bought a lot" 面白くて、最後まで読んだ "It was interesting, (so) I read to the end"

children.heading: て-form - Softest, most natural
children.content: 嬉しくて、泣いちゃった "I was happy, (so) I cried" Casual, conversational Natural flow

children.heading: から - Clear causation
children.content: 嬉しかったから、泣いた "Because I was happy, I cried" More explicit reason

children.heading: ので - Formal/objective
children.content: 嬉しかったので、涙が出ました "Because I was happy, tears came out" Polite, formal

children.heading: With emotions
children.content: 嬉しくて、泣いた "(I was so) happy, I cried" 悲しくて、何もできなかった "(I was so) sad, I couldn't do anything" 怖くて、見られない "(It's so) scary, I can't watch" 驚いて、声も出なかった "(I was so) surprised, I couldn't even speak"

children.heading: With states and conditions
children.content: 疲れて、眠い "(I'm) tired, (so) sleepy" お腹が空いて、力が出ない "(I'm) hungry, (so) I have no energy" 忙しくて、休めない "(I'm) busy, (so) I can't rest"

children.heading: With actions leading to results
children.content: 勉強して、合格した "(I) studied, (so/and) I passed" 走って、間に合った "(I) ran, (so/and) I made it in time" 頑張って、できるようになった "(I) tried hard, (so/and) became able to do it"

children.heading: More natural than から in casual speech
children.content: More natural: 高くて、買えない "It's expensive, (so) I can't buy it" Also correct: 高いから、買えない "Because it's expensive, I can't buy it" て sounds more conversational

children.heading: Shows direct connection
children.content: 雨が降って、濡れた "It rained, (and/so) I got wet" Direct cause → effect Immediate connection

children.heading: Cannot be used with commands
children.content: Wrong: 危なくて、気をつけて ❌ Right: 危ないから、気をつけて ✓ "It's dangerous, so be careful" Use から/ので for commands/requests

children.heading: Example 1: Explaining Situation
children.content: A: どうしたの？顔色悪いよ "What's wrong? You look pale" B: 昨日あまり寝られなくて、疲れてるんだ "I couldn't sleep much yesterday, so I'm tired" A: 大丈夫？ "Are you okay?"

children.heading: Example 2: Shopping Story
children.content: A: そのバッグ、いいね "That bag is nice" B: うん、デザインが気に入って、買っちゃった "Yeah, I liked the design, so I bought it" A: いくらだった？ "How much was it?"

children.heading: Example 3: Daily Life
children.content: A: 今日の試合、中止だって "Today's game is cancelled" B: え、なんで？ "Huh, why?" A: 雨が降って、グラウンドが使えないんだって "It rained, so the field can't be used"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using with commands
children.content: Wrong: 寒くて、窓を閉めて ❌ Right: 寒いから、窓を閉めて ✓ "It's cold, so close the window" Cannot use て with commands!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Too casual in formal situations
children.content: Too casual: 体調が悪くて、休みます ⚠️ Better: 体調が悪いので、休みます ✓ "I'm not feeling well, so I'll rest" Use ので in formal situations

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong て-form
children.content: Wrong: 高いて ❌ Right: 高くて ✓ "Expensive, so..." い-adjectives: 高い → 高くて

children.heading: "So... that"
children.content: 美味しくて、毎日食べてる "It's (so) delicious, I eat it every day" 面白くて、やめられない "It's (so) interesting, I can't stop" 難しくて、分からない "It's (so) difficult, I don't understand"

children.heading: Listing multiple reasons
children.content: 安くて、美味しくて、近い "It's cheap, delicious, and close" 親切で、面白くて、頭がいい "(He's) kind, interesting, and smart" Connecting multiple qualities

children.heading: Dropping particles
children.content: Very casual: お腹空いて、コンビニ行った Standard: お腹が空いて、コンビニに行った "I was hungry, (so) I went to the convenience store" Natural in conversation

children.heading: Using って instead of て
children.content: Casual: 高くって、買えない Standard: 高くて、買えない "It's expensive, (so) I can't buy it" って adds emphasis

children.heading: With volitional/intentional actions as reasons
children.content: Unnatural: 日本語を勉強して、日本に来た ⚠️ Better: 日本語を勉強するために、日本に来た ✓ "I came to Japan to study Japanese" Use ために for purpose

children.heading: With requests/suggestions following
children.content: Unnatural: 疲れて、休んだらどう？ ⚠️ Better: 疲れてるから、休んだらどう？ ✓ "You're tired, so how about resting?" Use から for suggestions

children.heading: Present state → Result
children.content: 寒くて、震えてる "It's cold, (so) I'm shivering" 高くて、手が出ない "It's expensive, (so) I can't afford it"

children.heading: Past event → Result
children.content: 雨が降って、試合が中止になった "It rained, (so) the match was cancelled" 勉強して、合格した "(I) studied, (so/and) I passed"

children.heading: Most casual to most formal
children.content: 1. 高くて、買えない (very casual) "It's expensive, can't buy it" 2. 高いから、買えない (casual) "It's expensive, so I can't buy it" 3. 高いので、買えません (polite) "It's expensive, so I can't buy it" 4. 価格が高いため、購入できません (formal) "Due to the high price, I cannot purchase it"

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 疲れて、眠い "(I'm) tired, (so) sleepy" 忙しくて、会えない "(I'm) busy, (so) can't meet" 嬉しくて、泣いた "(I was) happy, (so) I cried"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 道が混んでて、1時間も遅れちゃった "The road was crowded, (so) I was an hour late" この本、面白くて、一晩で読み終わっちゃった "This book was interesting, (so) I finished reading it in one night" 彼女が優しくて、みんなに好かれている "She's kind, (so) everyone likes her"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 昨日徹夜して、今日は頭が全然働かなくて、 仕事が全然進まない "I stayed up all night yesterday, so my brain isn't working at all today, and work isn't progressing at all" あまりにも感動的で言葉にならなくて、 ただ涙が止まらなかった "It was so moving I couldn't put it into words, and tears just wouldn't stop"
